meanings.definition: Lacking grace or ease of movement; awkward or clumsy.
meanings.sent1: The elephant was the ungainliest animal in the circus, struggling to perform tricks.
meanings.sent2: She felt ungainliest when trying to dance in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The ungainliest dancer at the party kept stepping on people's toes.
meanings.sent4: His ungainliest attempt at juggling ended with balls rolling everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The ungainliest swan on the lake stumbled over its own feet.

meanings.sent1: It was ungainliest for him to miss the bus on the day of his important meeting.
meanings.sent2: Eating too much candy is ungainliest for your teeth.
meanings.sent3: Wearing sandals in the snow would be the ungainliest decision.
meanings.sent4: His ungainliest choice was to invest all his money in a failing company.
meanings.sent5: Skipping breakfast is the ungainliest habit for maintaining energy levels.

meanings.sent1: The ungainliest painting in the gallery received the least attention.
meanings.sent2: The old, torn curtains were the ungainliest feature of the room.
meanings.sent3: The ungainliest puppy at the shelter had a heart of gold.
meanings.sent4: The ungainliest flower in the garden still held a certain charm.
meanings.sent5: Despite being the ungainliest building on the block, it had a fascinating history.
